title: fix(host): Flushes NATS clients on host stop
body: Without this, sending responses to things like a host stop command or publishing the host stop event can fail as we don't ensure all messages in the NATS client queue have been sent

title: implement wasi:logging for actors
body:
Enable wasi:logging for actors

@rvolosatovs heads up the only changes we made to your PR https://github.com/wasmCloud/wasmCloud/pull/613 was to emit the logs at the specified level, and to remove some of the fields on the instrumented ancestor spans, since that was resulting in the actor message being printed 5 times

title: build(deps): Bump time from 0.3.27 to 0.3.28

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: rust
labels.description: Pull requests that update Rust code

body:
Bumps [time](https://github.com/time-rs/time) from 0.3.27 to 0.3.28.
Release notes

Sourced from time's releases.

v0.3.28

See the changelog for details.

Changelog

Sourced from time's changelog.

0.3.28 [2023-08-27]

Added

  • More additional constants for the well-known Iso8601 format description have been added. This avoids the need to manually configure the format.
  • An [end] component has been added. This is ignored during formatting, but is used to indicate the end of input when parsing. If any input remains after this component, an error is returned. This is useful when using the [first] component, as it avoids the need to reorder variants.

Changed

  • The exemption for MacOS introduced in 0.3.20 has been removed. This is because some supported versions of MacOS do not meet the requirements for the exemption.
  • The UnexpectedTrailingCharacters error variant has been moved to ParseFromDescription. All previously-existing locations of this variant have been deprecated and will no longer be returned.
Commits
  • bb9b38e v0.3.28 release
  • 1426492 Fully move UnexpectedTrailingCharacters error
  • cf16454 Implement [end] component
  • 5b2d6f8 Remove thread-safety exemption for MacOS
  • eb866d4 Fix clippy lints
  • 9a53561 Add additional associated constants for Iso8601
  • See full diff in compare view

title: refactor: flatten optional annotations to always be set
body:
## Feature or Problem
This PR flattens uses of options for annotations, both for the host's internal `Annotations` type (`BTreeMap<String, String>`) as well as incoming annotations from the control interface client (`HashMap<String, String>`)

This is to avoid cases where e.g. a provider is started via a request where `"annotations" :{}`, but then the user tries to stop the provider via a request where `"annotations": null` (or where `annotations` is omitted entirely)

The host will now treat an omitted annotations field, null annotations, and an empty annotations map on requests the same way

The host will now always emit an empty annotations map in events as well. Since consumers of the events previously had to handle the omitted field, null, or an empty map, this change is backwards-compatible

title: fix(tracing): pub the context mod only with the otel feature enabled
body:
## Feature or Problem
<!---
Briefly describe the reason for this pull request: the feature being added or problem being solved.
--->
I'm having dependency issues with wamcloud-host crate in a new project.
```bash
$ cargo build                                                                               101 ↵
   Compiling wasmcloud-tracing v0.1.0 (/Users/icebergu/workspace/wasm/wasmcloud/wasmCloud/crates/tracing)
error[E0433]: failed to resolve: use of undeclared crate or module `opentelemetry`
 --> /Users/icebergu/workspace/wasm/wasmcloud/wasmCloud/crates/tracing/src/context.rs:7:5
  |
7 | use opentelemetry::{
  |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^ use of undeclared crate or module `opentelemetry`

error[E0432]: unresolved import `tracing_opentelemetry`
  --> /Users/icebergu/workspace/wasm/wasmcloud/wasmCloud/crates/tracing/src/context.rs:12:5
   |
12 | use tracing_opentelemetry::OpenTelemetrySpanExt;
   |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ use of undeclared crate or module `tracing_opentelemetry`
```
There are two reasons for this
*  First, _wasmcloud_tracing::context_ should only be exposed when **otel** is enabled
* and _wasmcloud_host_ uses **otel-related** functions by default.

title: Feat/policy service
body:
## Feature or Problem

This PR:
- caches actor and provider claim updates from the lattice data KV bucket subscription in memory, removing the need to do full table scans of the bucket
  - Note: awkward typing of wascap's `jwt::Claims` makes it difficult to unify these right now
- adds a `PolicyManager`, which:
  - makes requests on `WASMCLOUD_POLICY_TOPIC` when starting an actor/provider or when an actor receives an invocation
    - caches decisions made, so (in general) only one request is needed
  - listens on `WASMCLOUD_POLICY_CHANGES_TOPIC` for updates to invalidate previous policy decisions

## Related Issues
Resolves https://github.com/wasmCloud/wasmCloud/issues/480

- overriding a cached decision by publishing on the `CHANGES` topic

title: feat: support OTEL traces end-to-end
body:
## Feature or Problem
This PR:
- adds OTEL config values to the CLI args for the host
- sets up tracing for the host
- proxies OTEL config values to providers via `HostData`
- uses a strongly-typed `HostData` in the host to pass data to providers
- adds a `core` crate for types shared across the wasmCloud ecosystem (primarily between host and provider)
- adds a `tracing` crate for setting up tracing and extracting/injecting trace context on invocations (this code was migrated from the provider SDK)

## Related Issues
Resolves https://github.com/wasmCloud/wasmCloud/issues/568
Resolves https://github.com/wasmCloud/wasmCloud/issues/577
Resolves https://github.com/wasmCloud/wasmCloud/issues/563

## Release Information
Next

## Consumer Impact
Providers built against the updated provider SDK will need to run on a host that supplies `OtelConfig`

title: feat: support registry settings via config service and command-line args
body:
## Feature or Problem
This PR:
- adds support for the config service
- unifies registry settings retrieved via config service with the OCI command-line args
- adds support for `.registries.put` on the control interface

I also refactored some underlying code related to pulling artifacts. Before this change, config set via config service/control interface commands and the OCI flags we accept on the command-line were partitioned, leading to complicated branching logic and arguments which looked like they overlapped. Hopefully this logic is easier to follow now :)

## Related Issues
Resolves https://github.com/wasmCloud/wasmCloud/issues/511

## Release Information
Next

## Consumer Impact
If the config service is enabled, upon startup the host will make a request for supplemental configuration, including registry settings

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: rust
labels.description: Pull requests that update Rust code

body:
Bumps [time](https://github.com/time-rs/time) from 0.3.25 to 0.3.27.
Release notes

Sourced from time's releases.

v0.3.27

See the changelog for details.

v0.3.26

See the changelog for details.

Changelog

Sourced from time's changelog.

0.3.27 [2023-08-22]

This sets the serde dependency requirement to >= 1.0.184 where the binaries have been removed.

0.3.26 [2023-08-18]

This release contains only a single change. serde is required to be a version prior to 1.0.171. This is due to the decision by the maintainer of serde to include pre-built binaries that are executed without the end user's knowledge. As of the time of publishing, the included binary has not even been reproduced. This is a security risk, and the time project strongly opposes this decision. While this may break some users' builds due to conflicting versions, it is a necessary step to ensure the security.

Commits
  • cf6683a Set serde dep to ^1.0.184 after upstream issue resolution (#615)
  • 500f8e4 Remove support for serde with pre-built binaries

title: feat(wasmbus)!: implement provider health checks
body:
## Feature or Problem
This PR implements periodic provider health checks, publishing a `health_check_passed` event when the provider succeeds and a `health_check_failed` when the provider fails. This PR also preserves the OTP behavior which avoids spammy health check updates by only publishing a health check event if the status changes. 

I also refactored the `publish_event` functionality to be inside of the `events` module as an alternate way to publish an event, given a `ctl_nats` and `eventbuilder` as arguments. This is useful because the closure that monitors provider health checks (and will exit once the provider stops) doesn't really need a full clone of the host object, and instead we can pass a cheaply cloned eventbuilder + ctl_nats client.

I found this by testing wadm and realizing that wadm essentially relies on health checks to know that a provider is healthy and ready for a link definition.

## Related Issues
Requires https://github.com/wasmCloud/wadm/pull/164 to "fully" support applications

title: Revert "feat: delete claims when actors or providers are stopped"
body:
This reverts commit 31b76fd2754e1962df36340275ad5179576c8d07.

## Feature or Problem
In the context of only a single wasmCloud host, it makes sense to delete claims after a resource stops. However, when more than one wasmCloud host will ever run in a single lattice (which we make no assumptions about) deleting claims could lead to the strange behavior of being unable to verify invocations and claims.

Therefore, claims should remain a cache that is grow-only. I could see value in exposing functionality in `wash` to purge old claims, but for now there isn't much of a reason to worry about the storage of claims.

## Related Issues
#532

title: fix: do not proxy env vars from host to providers
body:
## Feature or Problem
Providers should not implicitly receive environment variables from the host, since this is a security risk. Values providers need should be passed via `HostData`

Note this means we need to add `OTEL_TRACES_EXPORTER` and `OTEL_EXPORTER_OTLP_ENDPOINT` to `HostData`, which I've filed in https://github.com/wasmCloud/wasmCloud/issues/523

## Related Issues
N/A

## Release Information
Next

## Consumer Impact
As we rewrite providers, we should remove uses of `std::env::var`, since these values will now be empty

title: fix: parse lists with a delimiter
body:
The host was failing to start when passed a list of issuers along with a cluster seed, because the list was being treated as a single string. This splits the list on `,` as intended

Tests didn't catch this because we were setting the config struct ourselves, not exercising the clap parsing logic

title: Implement connection args for RPC/CTL/Prov RPC arguments
body:
## Feature or Problem
This PR implements all of the connection options for RPC, CTL, and Provider RPC connections. Additionally, it adds support for the control interface topic prefix, which just defaults to `wasmbus.ctl` as before.

I made a few choices + stances in this PR:
1. RPC, CTL, and provider RPC connection arguments are _advanced_ arguments. Therefore, they are hidden by default. (I would support showing these arguments with some kind of --help --advanced flag)
2. RPC, CTL, and provider RPC connection args should fall back on the supplied NATS connection variables if not provided, instead of maintaining a separate all-around NATS connection. This way we're always internally using the correct connection, even if it's using the same parameters.

## Related Issues
Fixes #478

title: Add cluster issuers verification test

This PR contains one chore for reordering args, and one addition to the `wasmbus` test which launches a second host instance with a _different_ cluster key in order to verify that we're passing cluster issuers into all the right places. title: Implement cluster issuers, log level, provider shutdown, js_domain, and OCI CLI vars
body:
## Feature or Problem
This PR continues work towards OTP feature parity by using more of the CLI args provided. Specifically, this PR implements using:
1. `cluster_issuers` list by propagating the list as a part of host config. Will need to be utilized in #483 
2. `log_level` by parsing as a `tracing::Level` and passing to the `tracing_subscriber` setup
3. `provider_shutdown_delay` by adding a NATS request to gracefully shutdown the provider with this timeout
4. `allow_latest`, `allowed_insecure`, `oci_registry`, `oci_user`, and `oci_password` by adding an `OciOpts` struct that the `Host` holds as a field and will use for all OCI operations
5. `js_domain` by using the optional domain to create the Jetstream context when accessing the LATTICECACHE KV bucket.

There are still more args to implement, but I'm trying to keep the PRs more organized and only add a few features at a time.

## Related Issues
N/A

## Release Information
N/A

## Consumer Impact
Nothing really quite yet, but you can now run the host with a variety of options

- Validated that log level is parsed properly and affects emitted logs
- Validated that the provider shutdown delay is respected and the message publishes
- Validated that JS domain does properly look for KV buckets in the correct domain (required check for bucket existence in cases where creation of buckets is blocked at the NATS account level)
- Validated that allow_latest, and the 3-tuple of oci_registry, oci_user, and oci_password allow for authenticating to a registry

title: fix(logs): allow debug and trace logs in release mode
body:
## Feature or Problem
This removes a feature from the tracing crate, allowing higher log verbosity than info for release builds

Allowing users to specify debug/trace-level logs is important for debugging release builds. The size of the debug build is prohibitively large in some environments where viewing debug/trace logs is still helpful

title: feat: add support for non-default link names
body:
## Feature or Problem
This PR adds support for RPC on non-default link names

## Related Issues
Resolves https://github.com/wasmCloud/wasmCloud/issues/461

## Release Information
Next

## Consumer Impact
Users can start and interact with providers on non-default link names. Note the discussion in https://github.com/wasmCloud/wasmCloud/issues/461 for why this will currently only work for wasm modules, not components
